docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 bone in ham
  • 1 stick butter
  • 1 jar peach preserves
  • 2 tbsp BBQ rub
  • 1 cup water

docs.title: Steps
docs.text:
1. Preheat smoker to 225. Place bone in ham on smoker, as is, until internal temp reads 170.

  2. As you're nearing 170 internal, you'll want to start preparing the glaze.

  3. In a medium saucepan, combine butter, peach preserves, and BBQ rub. Heat on medium heat until melted and combined.

  4. Once the ham is 170, remove from smoker, and place in aluminum roasting pan cut side down. Pour water into bottom of the pan. Then pour the glaze over the top of the ham. Cover with foil and back onto the smoker.

  5. Increase smoker temp to 275, and roast until internal temp of 200. Remove, rest, and pull.

  6. I like to drizzle a few spoonfuls of the glaze over the shredded ham, and a little more sprinkles of the rub.

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 3.25 cups flour
  • 2 tbsp sugar
  • 1 tsp salt
  • 2.25 tsp instant yeast
  • 3 tbsp melted butter/oil
  • sesame or poppy seeds

docs.title: Steps
docs.text:
1. In a large mixing bowl, combine the flour, sugar, salt, and instant yeast. Add the warm water and melted butter/oil. Mix until a shaggy dough forms.

  2. Knead the dough on a lightly floured surface for 8-10 minutes (or 5-7 minutes with a stand mixer) until smooth and elastic.

  3. Place the dough in a greased bowl, cover, and let it rise in a warm place for 1 hour, or until doubled in size.

  4. Punch down the dough, divide it into 8 equal pieces, and shape each piece into a ball. Flatten slightly to form discs and place on a parchment-lined baking sheet.

  5. Cover the buns and let them rise for 35 minutes, or until puffy.

  6. If desired, brush the buns lightly with water and sprinkle sesame or poppy seeds on top.

  7. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C). Bake the buns for 15-18 minutes, or until golden brown.

  8. Let the buns cool on a wire rack before slicing.

docs.title: Steps
docs.text:
1. Sauté onions, carrots, and cellery until slightly browned. Add garlic, season with rosemary and thyme

  2. Pour in chicken broth, add ham bones and potatoes, simmer for 90 minutes

  3. Blend about half of the solids with an immersion blender

  4. Add in ham chunks, heavy cream, combine and simmer for an additional 15 minutes
